abstract.text: The central engine for performing card transactions with Quantum Pay.
Indicates whether the PaymentEngine is in Test mode, connected to the Test Quantum Pay server environment.
Retrieve the stored transaction with a specific transactionID
The available capabilities for the payment peripheral device.
The central engine for performing card transactions with Quantum Pay.
The event is raised when a transaction has a final result.
The event is raised when a connection to a peripheral changes state.
The event is raised when a peripheral indicates a message should be displayed in the user interface of the application.

Requests the PaymentEngine to immediately abort the active transaction, if it has not yet passed the stage
where it cannot be aborted any more.
Requests the PaymentEngine to connect to the peripheral devices.

event and/or the
delegate must be used to track connection

Assigns the delegate to use for handling EMV application selection.
The event is raised when the transaction requires signature verification. The host application is responsible for ensuring the user verifies the customer’s signature.
The provider responsible for configuring the PaymentEngine, transactions, invoices and the peripheral.
The unique identifier for the current instance of the POS application.

The process runs asynchronously so the events and delegates must be used to track transaction progress and
state changes.
The event is raised when a transaction changes state.
Assigns the delegate to use for handling peripheral messages which should be displayed in the application

Starts processing a transaction, including controlling the connected peripheral devices, if needed.
The process runs asynchronously so the events and delegates must be used to track transaction progress and

The timeout that will be used for transactions. The time will count down from the start of the transaction and the transaction will be terminated if a card has not been presented within the timeout period.
Get the EMV application supported by the presented payment card.
Assigns the delegate to use for handling signature verification during a transaction.
Current status of the mobile device currently has internet access for processing transactions online.

Obtain a decision from server.
The event is raised when a payment card is presented during a transaction that supports multiple EMV
applications and the user or customer needs to select one of the EMV applications to complete the
transaction.
Passing the signature handling requirement to user application.

The currently active transaction within the PaymentEngine.
Performs handling for the EMV application selection from the peripheral.
The final decision of a transaction to record.
Requests the PaymentEngine to disconnect the currently connected peripheral devices. Peripherals that are
connected via USB will be powered off but must be physically disconnected to prevent re-connecting.
Peripherals that are connected via Bluetooth LE will be disconnected.
